segments.text: I see the woman in the kitchen, busily drying her plate with a dish towel.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She seems so focused on her task that she doesn't notice the water spilling from the overflowing sink.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t help but feel a bit worried for her; the puddle is growing larger by the second.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s almost as if she’s in her own world, completely oblivious to the chaos around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The sunlight streaming in through the window highlights the mess, yet she remains unaffected.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the boy on the stool, stretching for those cookies, and my heart races a bit.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: His posture is so precarious, I worry he might topple over at any moment.
segments.speaker: PAR
